title: Apple Executive Leaves Company After Crude Joke Made in Viral TikTok Video; Tony Blevins, Apple's procurement chief, leaves after more than two decades with the iPhone giant
text:
Mr. Blevins appeared in a short video published by a TikTok and Instagram creator named Daniel Mac, where he asks people driving luxury cars what they do for a living. The Apple executive was parking his Mercedes-Benz SLR McLaren when the video was shot.

"I have rich cars, play golf and fondle big-breasted women, but I take weekends and major holidays off," Mr. Blevins said, according to the video's captions, which has been viewed 1.3 million times on TikTok.

He also said he had "a hell of a dental plan."

Bloomberg News earlier reported his departure.

Apple CEO Tim Cook brought Mr. Blevins over to the tech giant in 2000 from International Business Machines Corp. He started in procurement and moved up through the ranks. He negotiated deals with suppliers and developed a reputation for keeping costs down for Apple.

Mr. Blevins also worked with Apple's contract manufacturers and managed the purchase of parts such as modem chips for iPhones.

Last year, Appleparted ways with an advertising-technology executive weeks after hiring him. Antonio García Martínez left the company after fellow Apple employees complained about sexist and misogynistic passages in a memoir he wrote about his time at Facebook.
